means: （尤指猛禽的）爪( talon的名词复数 )

sentence.Network_en: The fingers were curved like talons , but they closed on empty air.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的指头弯得像鹰爪一样, 可是抓了个空.

sentence.Network_en: The tiger has a pair of talons.
The owls'formidable talons can carry birds up to the size of a chicken.
sentence.Network_cn: 猫头鹰的利爪能抓起鸡那么大小的鸟儿.

PerfectNetExp.abs: In New Mexico , the talons of the red tailed hawk will find an easy target ., 新墨西哥州的红尾鹰凭借一双尖爪很容易找到猎物.
his blessing has since been appreciated by the Dwarves , as mines beneath the slopes where his talons once perched pour forth ore abundantly .矮人们至今感激他的祝福：在他曾歇过脚的山坡下，矿石大量地从矿坑中涌出。

entry.def: The talons of a bird of prey are its hooked claws.
